sen.j: 新田駅（しんでんえき）は、京都府宇治市広野町東裏にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）奈良線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Higashi-ura, Hirono-cho of Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, Shinden Station is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Shinden Station, located in Higashi-ura, Hirono-cho of Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Shinden Station, located in Higashi-ura, Hirono-cho of Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅で、京都側複線・城陽側単線の行違い可能駅。
sen.e: An above ground station having two platforms opposite each other and two tracks, double tracked on the Kyoto side, single tracked on the Joyo side and at which trains can pass each other or pass others.

It is an above-ground station having two platforms opposite each other and two tracks, double-tracked on the Kyoto side and single-tracked on the Joyo side, at which trains can pass each other or pass others.

It is an above-ground station having two platforms opposite each other and two tracks, double-tracked on the Kyoto side and single-tracked on the Joyo side, at which trains can pass each other or pass others.

sen.j: 駅本屋側ホームが1番線（上り）、反対側のホームが2番線（下り）。
sen.e: The station building side platform is for Track #1 (inbound) boarding and the opposite platform for Track #2 (outbound.) boarding.
The station building side platform is for track No. 1 (inbound) boarding and the opposite platform for track No. 2 (outbound) boarding.
The station building side platform is for Platform 1 (inbound) and the opposite platform for Platform 2 (outbound).

sen.j: 双方のホームは無蓋跨線橋で結ばれている。
sen.e: Both platforms are connected by an open passengers' overpass.
The two platforms are connected by an open passenger overpass.
The two platforms are connected by an open passenger overpass.

sen.j: 小さな木造駅舎が現役で、駅前にそびえ立つ2本の大木（コブシ、イチョウ）は、宇治市銘木百選にも選ばれている立派なものである。
sen.e: The small wooden structure is still being used to house station administrative offices and the two large trees (a magnolia kobus and a gingko) standing in front of the are truly magnificent and have been chosen to be amongst the one hundred famous trees of Uji City.
sen.cmt: "現役"はいいとして、"何時からの"が入ってっいなければ（例えば"開業時の、"や "築50年"等）その記述理由が疑問と思われます。
sen.e: The small wooden structure is still being used to house the station administrative offices, while the two large trees (a magnolia kobus and a gingko) standing in front are truly magnificent and have been included among the 100 famous trees of Uji City.

The small wooden structure is still being used to house the station administrative offices, while the two large trees (a magnolia kobus and a gingko) standing in front are truly magnificent and have been included among the 100 famous trees of Uji City.

sen.j: 駅業務は（株）ジェイアール西日本交通サービスへ委託されている。
sen.e: Station operations are commissioned to JR-West Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to JR-West Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅。
sen.e: ICOCA and J Through Cards can be used.
ICOCA and J Through cards can be used.
ICOCA and J-Thru cards can be used.

sen.j: ICOCAの相互利用対象である東日本旅客鉄道（JR東日本）のSuica、スルッとKANSAI協議会のPiTaPa、東海旅客鉄道（JR東海）のTOICAも利用可能。
sen.e: East Japan Railway Company (JR-East) SUICA Cards subject to mutual use with ICOCA Cards, Surutto Kansai Association PiTaPa Cards and Tokai Railway Company (JR-Tokai) TOICA Cards also can be used.
East Japan Railway Company (JR-East) SUICA cards subject to mutual use with ICOCA cards, Surutto Kansai Association PiTaPa cards and Tokai Railway Company (JR-Tokai) TOICA cards also can be used.

East Japan Railway Company (JR East) SUICA Cards subject to mutual use with ICOCA cards, Surutto KANSAI Association PiTaPa cards and Central Japan Railway Company (JR Tokai) TOICA cards also can be used.
sen.cmt: Central Japan Railway Companyとしました。

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization status
Usage status
Usage status

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約2,734人である。
sen.e: The number of passengers getting on at this station was approximately 2,734 per day in 2006.
sen.cmt: "約"は"平均"であるべきとは思われましたがそのままに、"ある"は"あった"にしました。
sen.e: The number of passengers getting on at this station was approximately 2,734 per day in 2006.
The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 2,734 per day in fiscal year 2006.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Station surroundings
Station surroundings
Station surroundings

sen.j: 旧久世郡の中心部付近、宇治市の南西部に位置し、城陽市、久世郡久御山町も徒歩圏で、近鉄京都線と大久保駅付近でX（エックス字）型に接し、バスターミナルから各方面へバス路線が張り巡らせられ、また駅のすぐそばにはレンタカーの店舗も数店あり、一帯は京都府南部地域（人口約60万人）の交通連接点、経済の中心地として今後の整備と発展が期待される。
sen.e: Located near the center of former Kuse-gun and in the southwestern part of Uji City, Kumiyama-cho, Kuse-gun of Joyo City is also within walking distance, JR-West Nara Line and Kintetsu Kyoto Line tracks come close together and then sharply separate in an 'X' like configuration near Okubo Station, a network of routed buses is available at the bus terminal, a number of rental car dealers have established shops nearby and, as the junction of the southern regions of Kyoto Prefecture (population approx. 600,000) and an economic center, further improvements and development of the neighborhood can be anticipated in the days to come..
sen.cmt: 駅（と思われる）ものが"X字型に接し"は不可解ですが、地図で調べた結果、訳文のようなことかと推測するにいたり、原文には無い表現を入れざるを得ませんでした。ても何でかかることを入れなければならないのでしょうか？
sen.e: Located near the center of former Kuse-gun and in the southwestern part of Uji City, Kumiyama-cho, Kuse-gun of Joyo City is also within walking distance, JR-West Nara Line and Kintetsu Kyoto Line tracks come close together and then sharply separate in an 'X' configuration near Okubo Station; a network of routed buses is available at the bus terminal, a number of rental car dealers have established shops nearby and, as the junction of the southern regions of Kyoto Prefecture (population approx. 600,000) and an economic center, further improvements and development of the neighborhood can be anticipated in the days to come.

Located near the center of the former Kuse-gun in the southwestern part of Uji City, with Joyo City and Kumiyama-cho of Kuse-gun also at walking distance, JR West Nara Line and Kintetsu Kyoto Line tracks come close together and then sharply separate in an X configuration near Okubo Station; a network of routed buses is available at the bus terminal, a number of rental car dealers have established offices nearby and, as the junction of the southern regions of Kyoto Prefecture (population approximately 600,000) and an economic center, further improvements and development of the neighborhood can be anticipated in the days to come.
sen.cmt: 久世郡城陽市→城陽市と久世郡久御山町としました。

sen.j: 大久保駅 (京都府)（近鉄京都線）……西へ徒歩5分ほど。
sen.e: Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (Kinestsu Kyoto Line)……some 5min. on foot to the west.
Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (Kintestsu Kyoto Line)……some five minutes on foot to the west.
Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (Kintetsu Kyoto Line) -- some five minutes on foot to the west.
sen.cmt: ・・・を-- としました。 Kintetsuに修正

sen.e: Japan Ground Self-Defence Force Okubo Base
Japan Ground Self-Defence Force Okubo Base
Japan Ground Self-Defense Force Okubo Base

sen.e: EnzoinTemple

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）1月25日 - 奈良鉄道 桃山駅～玉水駅間延伸と同時に開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated on Jan. 25, 1896 simultaneously with Nara Line being extended from Momoyama Station to Tamamizu Station.
It was inaugurated on January 25, 1896 simultaneously with the Nara Line's extension from Momoyama Station to Tamamizu Station.
January 25, 1896: The station was inaugurated simultaneously with the Nara Line's extension from Momoyama Station to Tamamizu Station.

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）2月7日 - 合併により関西鉄道の駅になる。
sen.e: Became a Kansei Railway Company station on Feb. 7, 1905 from amalgamation.
It became a Kansei Railway Company station on Feb. 7, 1905 from amalgamation.
February 7, 1905: The station became a Kansai Railway Company station due to amalgamation.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）10月1日 - 関西鉄道が鉄道国有法。
sen.e: Kansei Railway Company nationalized on Oct. 1, 1907 under the Railway Nationalization Act.
sen.cmt: 関西i鉄道が"鉄道国有化法"で終わりは？
sen.e: Kansei Railway Company was nationalized on Oct. 1, 1907 under the Railway Nationalization Act.
October 1, 1907: Kansai Railway Company was nationalized under the Railway Nationalization Act.

sen.j: 日本国有鉄道新田駅になる。
sen.e: Became Japanese National Railways' Shinden station.
It became Japanese National Railways' Shinden station.
It became Japan National Railways' Shinden station.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
sen.cmt: 日本国有鉄道から国鉄への経緯脱落？
sen.e: It became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West station due to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 2001年（平成13年）3月3日 - 宇治駅 (JR西日本)～当駅間が複線化。
sen.e: The section between Uji Station (JR-West) and Shinden Station became double tracked on March 3, 2001.
The section between Uji Station (JR-West) and Shinden Station became double-tracked on March 3, 2001.
March 3, 2001: The section between Uji Station (JR West) and Shinden Station became double-tracked.

sen.j: また同時に、ダイヤ改正によって快速停車駅に格上げとなる（但し、みやこ路快速は通過）。
sen.e: Simultaneously upgraded to a rapid train stopping station coinciding with timetable revision, (but Miyakoji rapid trains do not stop.)
Simultaneously, it was upgraded to a rapid train stopping station to coincide with the timetable revision, (but Miyakoji rapid trains do not stop).
Simultaneously, it was upgraded to a rapid train stopping station to coincide with the timetable revision (but Miyakoji Rapid Service does not stop).
